comment._content: I'd say a little further along, looking up High Street to Church Street: maps.google.co.uk/?ll=54.345579,-7.639596&spn=0.00108...

comment.author: 8214568@N08
comment._content: 2009: The buildings haven't changed, but the cars have!

comment.author: 56105315@N07
comment._content: This jumped off the screen as soon as I saw the thumbnail. I went to school in Enniskillen from 65 to 71, so this view is more than familiar. Can't remember the name of the street though.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I didn't go to school there but I spent a lot of time up there over the years, working, swimming, rowing and socialising.  I always liked it as a town and was broken hearted when the bomb went off there and killed all those poor people!

comment.author: 56105315@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] I was gone from there by the time of the big bomb. It was devastating for the town though. I know the spot where it went off, there used to be a motorcycle shop on that square, where as a wided eyed youngster I would go and drool over the bikes and generally get in the way!

comment.author: 38088948@N05
comment._content: Fabulous shot!

comment._content:
Jordans now appears to be the Halifax but the shop next to it is still Wessley J Elliot as in this photo !!

From junction of Townhall Street and Paget Square looking up High Street.

comment._content: Was in Enniskillen May of last year, lovely town, nice people and great to photograph, especially along the Lough Erne & the streets as you see here, lovely spot!

comment._content: That view has hardly changed since.

comment.author: 44476982@N05
comment._content: I just about remember Paget Square. There used to be a row of small shops there, if i remember correctly. where the RBL and KFC are today

comment.author: 80107319@N05
comment._content:
Hate to be a pedant but Townhall St ends at The Diamond, which lies to the east - behind the photographer. This shot shows what is known locally as "The Hollow", with High St becoming Church St at Charlie's Bar (which is at 1 Church St) - which can be seen on the right. Very little has in fact changed. 
Wether spoons is indeed on Townhall St, but the only two pubs in this scene are Charlie's and the famous Blake's of the Hollow, which is just out of the camera's range to the left.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/80107319@N05] You're not being at all pedantic! Thank you for the information - have added into the description under the photo above...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
